intro: Xysmalobium sessile, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact, low-growing habit with opposite leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Xysmalobium sessile is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
